Ralph looks at Gilda with almost as much dismay as Alan.
Jesus Fucking Christ!    I'm getting the hell out of here.
Ralph storms out.
As Ralph moves along, a paunchy POLICEMAN intercepts him.
Now what?
Lieutenant Wasserman assigned me to you. Where you go--
I get the picture. Try not to shoot me or your fat ass, okay?

head_text.subj: BERRISFORD'S SILENT IMAGE ON A VIDEO SCREEN

text: The newscast continues silently on the TV in her room. is getting dressed. She peaks out the door.

The Policeman assigned to her is down the hall a ways, chatting with a nurse. Cynthia slips out and down the corridor. She waits for an elevator. When a door opens, she tries t inconspicuously slip inside but she finds herself face to face with Alan who in just getting out of the elevator. H holds a grocery bag.
Isn't this a coincidence?
I'm getting out of here.
He takes her arm and starts leading her back to her room.
Believe it or not, this is the safest place for you to be. The police are here. There are doctors here. And I'm going to keep you company, all night. I even brought provisions.
He shows a variety of fast food.
Pure unadulterated junk. At this point, who cares about the chemicals?
She smiles slightly. He holds his arm out for her like a swain escorting his date. She takes it in a similar spiri
The policeman comes out of Cynthia's room, looking for he alarm. He's instantly relieved to see her there with Alan Alan directs her inside. She goes. Alan gives the Policem a look.
Try harder next time.
He goes into her room, leaving the embarrassed cop behind Suddenly the LIGHTS RETURN with an eye-jarring FLASH. The cop has his revolver halfway out of the holster before he realizes what it is.

They both react   to the returned power with relief. Alan takes the stuff   out of the bag: chips, dips, cookies, s packs of beer.    He offers some of the chips. She shakes head. The TV's    still on. Alan switches channels with t sound muted.
(with frightening casualness) Connie and Ed aren't going to be the last.
Yes, they are. Everyone's under protection. Nothing can happen.
pointing upwards. An outstretched hand SLAMS itself down, the blade impaling through the palm. The hand squirms its fingers a bit, then pulls off.

He gets up clenching the perforated hand. He is very calm He closes the knife and puts it in a drawer. Suddenly, violently, he kicks a trash bin.      Then he i again. Ralph's assigned Policeman pokes his head in the door.
Everything okay?
Ralph sticks his hand behind him.       He is very friend normal. He smiles.
Yes, thank you, officer. Hey, lemme buy you a cup of coffee.
(shrugging) Sounds good to me.
Ralph comes out of his room. Ralph's policeman is beside him. His hand bleeds, but goes unnoticed.

Alan lies back in front of the TV, eyes closed, SNORING. Sympathetic, Cynthia slips the remote control from his hand... then there is a KNOCK at the door. She goes there finds Ralph, who steps inside.
(to his cop) Just a sec.
Ralph? What is it?
Nothing. I just came to tell you-- (smiling, conspiratorially) Everything's gonna be okay.
What's going to be okay?
He goes into the bathroom and rinses his blood-soaked han Cynthia sees this.
What happened to your hand?
Don't worry. Everything's gonna be okay.
Ralph?
Cynthia is mystified.    He goes.
Ralph walks off, his Policeman following.
(yelling down the hall) Ralph?
She comes in and pokes Alan awake.
Ralph was just here.   His hand was... all bloody.
They go to the door and they are immediately faced with Hettie.
Dr. Goldman, have you seen Ralph?
I was going to ask you the same thing.
She holds up a paper cup with a tablet in it.
He didn't take his four o'clock. If he misses this one, I'm gonna...
Alan takes the capsule, examines it.
Shit! It's his tranquilizer! If he doesn't take this, he'll completely flip out--!
Alan and Cynthia run down the hall.     Cynthia's policem follows.
Alan and Cynthia and the policeman scan for Ralph.
Look.
Every five or six feet along in a line, there is a modera sized droplet splatter of blood. They follow the droplets along the hallway. They follow the droplets through a set of double doors.
Ralph walks along, his policeman trailing.        No one around.
Are you sure you know where you're going? Ralph stops suddenly and turns to him. Ralph smiles warml Suddenly he hits the cop in the head using two fists. The cop falls.
Alan and Cynthia's policeman move down the hall, followin the drops, scanning in doorways. Cynthia is just behind them. These hallways are unused.       Nobody around.
Was he behaving strangely?
No more strangely than everybody also in this place.
(with walkie-talkie)
I can't get him. He must be shut off.
They pass an open freight elevator.       Cynthia looks i stops. There is a droplet of blood on the floor inside.
Hey.
A BLOODY HAND reaches out of the elevator covering her mo and pulls her inside.
Ralph holds her, slams the gate closed, and flips the swi The car moves down. Cynthia SCREAMS.
Alan and the policeman rush up just as the car disappears
Cynthia!
They descend.       She wipes blood from her face.   He l wired.
Ralph, we have to go and get your medication.
She slowly moves to the control panel. He watches her. Ju as she is about to reach the buttons, he violently pushes back.
Relax.
He smiles.
The elevator comes down to a stop. Ralph throws the door open. It is a huge dark space, a vast store room. Cynthia won't come out. Ralph gestures politely.
CYNTHIA
Ralph, I'm not going out.    We have to go back upstairs. Ralph grabs her firmly and pulls her out. CYNTHIA (CONT'D)
Ralph, please! RALPH
I have to talk to you. He leans in the elevator, opens the control panel and yan some wires. Sparks fly. The HUM of the elevator motor die Cynthia is panicked. RALPH (CONT'D)
It's very, very, very, very, very important that I talk to you. CYNTHIA
Ralph, you're not being yourself. Can't you tell? RALPH

No!   This is the real me! He flies across the basement and, grabbing a chair, smash the control box for the electric cargo door, the only oth entrance. He darts up a storage aisle.      He rips a phone off the RALPH (CONT'D)
I come down here a lot. It helps me unwind. Cynthia can't see him. He wildly paces up and down the storage aisles. Cynthia starts to cry. CYNTHIA
Ralph, please! How do we get out? RALPH
It's been said by better men than me in better ways in better times-- there is no way out! She goes to a barred window. CYNTHIA
Help!

Ralph goes into a rage. He pushes over a huge storage she Everything spills and breaks. Amid the rubble a pile of surgical blades lies glinting in a pool of light. Ralph looks down at it.
